variables.name: state
variables.description: Two-digit state 2010 FIPS code

variables.name: county
variables.description: Three-digit county 2010 FIPS code

variables.name: tract
variables.description: Six-digit tract 2010 FIPS code

variables.name: state_name
variables.description: State name

variables.name: county_name
variables.description: County name

variables.name: cz
variables.description: Commuting zone identifier (1990 definition)

variables.name: czname
variables.description: Commuting zone name

variables.name: has_dad_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children who have a male claimer in the year they are linked to parents

variables.name: has_mom_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children who have a female claimer in the year they are linked to parents

variables.name: jail_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction incarcerated on April 1st, 2010 (where incarceration is defined as residing in a federal detention center, federal prison, state prison, local jail, residential correctional facility, military jail, or juvenile correctional facility)

variables.name: kfr_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of household income (i.e. own earnings and spouse’s earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample

variables.name: kfr_stycz_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of household income (i.e. own earnings and spouse’s earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample, but restricted to children who live in one of their childhood commuting zones in adulthood

variables.name: kfr_top01_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Probability of reaching the top 1% of the national household income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

variables.name: kfr_top20_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Probability of reaching the top quintile of the national household income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

variables.name: kfr_[age]_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean percentile rank (relative to other children in the same year) in the national distribution of household income measured at [age] 24, 26, and 29

variables.name: kir_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of individual income (i.e. just own earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample

variables.name: kir_stycz_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of individual income (i.e. just own earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample, but restricted to children who live in one of their childhood commuting zones in adulthood

variables.name: kir_top01_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Probability of reaching the top 1% of the national individual income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

variables.name: kir_top20_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Probability of reaching the top quintile of the national individual income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

variables.name: kir_[age]_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean percentile rank (relative to other children in the same year) in the national distribution of individual income measured at [age] 24, 26, and 29

variables.name: lpov_nbh_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction children who grew up in a given tract and end up living in a tract with a poverty rate of less than 10% (according to tract-level Census 2000 data) in adulthood. Tracts where children live as adults are defined as the tract of the last non-missing address observed on tax returns

variables.name: married_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children who file their federal income tax return as “married filing jointly” or “married filing separate” in 2015

variables.name: marr_[age]_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children who file their federal income tax return as “married filing jointly” or “married filing separate” at [age] 26, 29, and 32

variables.name: spouse_rk_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Mean individual income rank in 2014-15 for the spouses of children who grew up in the given tract. Child’s spouse refers to the person they are married to in 2015

variables.name: staycz_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children who live in one of their childhood commuting zones in adulthood

variables.name: stayhome_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children who live at the same address as their parents in 2015

variables.name: staytract_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of individuals who live in one of their childhood Census tracts in adulthood

variables.name: teenbrth_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of women who grew up in the given tract who ever claimed a child who was born when they were between the ages of 13 and 19 as a dependent at any point

variables.name: two_par_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children claimed by two people in the year they are linked to parents

variables.name: working_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children with positive W-2 earnings in 2015

variables.name: work_[age]_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile]
variables.description: Mean predicted outcome for children of a given race, gender and with parents at a given percentile in the national household income distribution. ● [race] is either pooled, white, black, hisp (Hispanic), asian, natam (Native American), or other ● [gender] is either pooled, male, or female ● [pctile] is either 1, 25, 50, 75, or 100 Fraction of children with positive W-2 earnings at [age] 24, 26, 29, and 32

variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_p[pctile] Fraction of children who have a male claimer in the year they are linked to parents

variables.name: kir_stycz_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Mean percentile rank (relative to other children born in the same year) in the national distribution of individual income (i.e. just own earnings) measured as mean earnings in 2014-2015 for the baseline sample, but restricted to children who live in one of their childhood commuting zones in adulthood

variables.name: kir_top01_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Probability of reaching the top 1% of the national individual income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

variables.name: kir_top20_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Probability of reaching the top quintile of the national individual income distribution (among children born in the same year) in 2014-15

variables.name: kir_[age]_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Mean percentile rank (relative to other children in the same year) in the national distribution of individual income measured at [age] 24, 26, and 29

variables.name: lpov_nbh_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction children who grew up in a given tract and end up living in a tract with a poverty rate of less than 10% (according to tract-level Census 2000 data) in adulthood. Tracts where children live as adults are defined as the tract of the last non-missing address observed on tax returns

variables.name: married_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children who file their federal income tax return as “married filing jointly” or “married filing separate” in 2015

variables.name: marr_[age]_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children who file their federal income tax return as “married filing jointly” or “married filing separate” at [age] 26, 29, and 32

variables.name: spouse_rk_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Mean individual income rank in 2014-15 for the spouses of children who grew up in the given tract. Child’s spouse refers to the person they are married to in 2015

variables.name: staycz_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children who live in one of their childhood commuting zones in adulthood

variables.name: stayhome_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children who live at the same address as their parents in 2015

variables.name: staytract_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of individuals who live in one of their childhood Census tracts in adulthood

variables.name: teenbrth_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of women who grew up in the given tract who ever claimed a child who was born when they were between the ages of 13 and 19 as a dependent at any point

variables.name: two_par_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children claimed by two people in the year they are linked to parents

variables.name: working_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children with positive W-2 earnings in 2015

variables.name: work_[age]_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for [outcome]_[race]_[gender]_mean Fraction of children with positive W-2 earnings at [age] 24, 26, 29, and 32

variables.name: has_dad_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Number of children of race [race] and gender [gender] with non-missing data used to construct the estimate for [outcome]  Fraction of children who have a male claimer in the year they are linked to parents

variables.name: has_mom_[race]_[gender]_n

variables.name: par_rank_[race]_[gender]_mean
variables.description: Mean household income rank for parents of children of race [race] and gender [gender]. Parents are ranked relative to other parents with children in the same birth cohort (averaged over 1994-1995 and 1998-2000)

variables.name: par_rank_[race]_[gender]_mean_se
variables.description: Estimated standard error for par_rank_[race]_[gender]_mean

variables.name: kid_[race]_[gender]_n
variables.description: Count of children under 18 of race [race] and gender [gender] in the tract in 2000 (from publicly available 2000 Decennial Census data)

variables.name: frac_below_median_[race]_[gender]
variables.description: Fraction of children with parents who have income below the national median for parents with children in the same birth cohort. Children are weighted by the total number of childhood years spent in the tract.

variables.name: kid_[race]_[gender]_blw_p50_n
variables.description: Number of children under 18 living in the given tract with parents whose household income was below the national median. This is computed by multiplying the number of children living in the tract according to the 2000 Decennial Census (kid_[race]_[gender]_n) by the fraction of children living in households in which the parents earn less than the national median  in the relevant analysis sample (frac_below_median_[race]_[gender]). We use this variable as our preferred population weighting variable when analyzing these outcomes across places

variables.name: frac_years_xw_[race]_[gender]
variables.description: Mean fraction of possible childhood years (up to age 23) children spent in this tract. This is calculated over children who spent any time in this tract.
